revised_title: Nuclear Electron Double Resonance Apparatus at High Magnetic Fields
tldr: The authors describe the development of an apparatus for nuclear electron double resonance at 12,500 gauss, allowing for the study of interactions between electrons and nuclei in solutions at high magnetic fields. The instrument provides enhanced signal-to-noise ratios and improved resolving power, enabling the observation of previously undetectable resonances and offering insights into the mechanisms of interactions in the solution.
